title: `structure_load` only appends `extra_flags`, does not allow to prepend them
body:
### Steps to reproduce

When using `structure_load_flags`, if the flags contain the `--set` command to change run-time configuration parameters, those will not be taken into account by `psql` if they are passed after the `--file` parameter. With the way `structure_load` is written, all `extra_args` are prepended, there is no option to append them, making it impossible to update an extension setting.

In our case we need to change a specific postgres extension setting to make the load command work, which forces us to monkey patch the `structure_load` like so:

```
  def structure_load(filename, extra_flags)
    # The change is this monkey patch is only to prepend extra_flags instead of appending them
    args = ['--set', 'ON_ERROR_STOP=1', '--quiet', '--no-psqlrc', '--output', File::NULL, '--file', filename]
    args = Array(extra_flags) + args if extra_flags
    args << db_config.database
    run_cmd('psql', args, 'loading')
  end
```

### Expected behavior

I can chose the order of `extra_flags` relative to the `--file` parameter. 

### Actual behavior

`extra_flags` are always set after `--file`, and will not always be taken into account by the `psql` command.

### System configuration

**Rails version**: Rails 7.2.2.1

**Ruby version**: Ruby 3.3.7


### Options to fix this behavior

1. Update `structure_load` to prepend the `extra_flags`: I believe this could cause the opposite of my current issue to other users, I wouldn't recommend it
2. Add a new argument to `structure_load`, with default set to nil (no breaking change), that would be `extra_flags_prepended` or something like that, and would be set the same way `structure_load_flags` is 
3. Change the structure of `structure_load`'s `extra_flags`: now instead of being an array/a hash with array value, it would be a 2-dimensional array, `[[flags_prepended], [flags_appended]]`. Breaking change but an easy fix.

I'll be happy to write the fix, I'd like to know what would be the best option to do so beforehand.
